task.title: Key Rotation
task.shortdesc: This task describes the process for rotating cryptographic keys to ensure security and compliance with Company policies.

context.note: Rotation requires split knowledge for creating new keys. The process will require 2 members of the key_custodian security group.
context.p: Keys are generated with a maximum lifetime of 5 years. However, 5 of the 25 are replaced every six months making their active lifespan roughly 2.5 years. Keys are rotated as follows:

step.cmd: Identify the 5 oldest keys in the set for rotation.

info.p: Determine which cryptographic keys require rotation. This may include encryption keys for databases, SSL/TLS certificates, API keys, or any other security-related keys.

step.cmd: Using the Company Encryption Tool, create 5 new keys.
Update systems to use new keys.

info.p: Replace old keys with the newly generated keys in all systems that use them.

step.cmd: Re-key the data encrypted by the disabled keys.

info.p: Ensure that encryption, decryption, and secure communication is as expected with the new keys.

step.cmd: Maintain disabled keys a decrypt-only state for three and half years.
Remove the oldest 5 keys from the pool.

info.p: After successfully verifying the new key usage, securely remove the old keys.
